header.description: Property.  Single range reading from an active ranger that emits energy and reports  one range reading that is valid along an arc at the distance measured.  This message is not appropriate for laser scanners. See the LaserScan  message if you are working with a laser scanner.  This message also can represent a fixed-distance (binary) ranger. This  sensor will have min_range = = = max_range = = = distance of detection.  These sensors follow REP 117 and will output -Inf if the object is detected  and +Inf if the object is outside of the detection range.  timestamp in the header is the time the ranger

field_of_view.description: Property.  (sound, IR, etc) [enum]  the size of the arc that the distance reading is

min_range.description: Property.  valid for [rad]  the object causing the range reading may have  been anywhere within -field_of_view/2 and  field_of_view/2 at the measured range.  0 angle corresponds to the x-axis of the sensor.  minimum range value [m]

range.description: Property.  Fixed distance rangers require min_range = = max_range  range data [m]
